bibl.idno: The Philip S. Hench Walter Reed/Yellow Fever Collection [manuscript] / [collected by] Philip S. Hench ; HEALTHSCI MS-1.

div1.head: Newspaper clipping, February 5, [1903]
div1.p:
House Committee Will Consider
Senate Bill Tomorrow.

Washington, Feb. 5.--The House Com-
mittee on Invalid Pensions will tomor-
row consider the bill passed by the Sen-
ate yesterday granting a pension of $125
a month to Mrs. Emily Lawrence Reed,
widow of Dr. Walter Reed, surgeon in
the United States Army, who discovered
the cause of the spread of yellow fever
and means for its prevention.

A bill was introduced in the Senate for
the relief of Mrs. Reed by Senator Mar-
tin of Virginia several weks ago. It
provided for a pension of $333 a month
for her. The Senate Committee on Pen-
sions reduced this amount to $125.

Representative Hay of Virginia will
have charge of the bill during its pas-
sage through the House.
